metadata.title: Life Events Table
metadata.description: Mongoose Traveller 2nd Edition Life Events (2D6 table)
metadata.usage: Used during character creation, career events, and pre-career events

events.title: Sickness or Injury
events.description: You are injured or become sick. Roll on the Injury table (see page 49).

effect.description: Roll on the Injury table for consequences

narrative.setup: Their body betrayed them at a crucial moment, whether through accident, illness, or misfortune.
narrative.consequence: This physical setback would test their resilience and potentially alter their capabilities permanently.
narrative.worldBuilding: In the dangerous galaxy of the 57th century, injury and illness are constant companions to those who live adventurous lives.

events.title: Birth or Death
events.description: Someone close to you dies, like a friend or family member. Alternatively, someone close to you gives birth (or is born!). You are involved in some fashion (father or mother, relative, godparent and so forth).

effect.description: Choose between death of loved one or birth of new family member

options.description: A loved one dies - emotional impact and possible inheritance
New family member born - gain dependent or responsibility

narrative.setup: The cycle of life touched them deeply, bringing either profound loss or new responsibility.
narrative.consequence: This pivotal moment would reshape their priorities and emotional landscape forever.
narrative.worldBuilding: Life and death remain the great constants across all worlds and species in the galaxy.

events.title: Ending of Relationship
events.description: A romantic relationship involving you ends. Badly. Gain a Rival or Enemy.

effect.description: Romantic relationship ends badly - gain Rival or Enemy

options.description: Gain a Rival (bitter breakup but not complete hatred)
Gain an Enemy (relationship ended with betrayal or cruelty)

narrative.setup: Love turned to bitterness as a romantic relationship collapsed in spectacular fashion.
narrative.consequence: The painful ending would leave lasting scars and create a persistent antagonistic relationship.
narrative.worldBuilding: Matters of the heart remain complicated across all cultures and species, often creating lasting enmities.

events.title: Improved Relationship
events.description: A romantic relationship involving you deepens, possibly leading to marriage or some other emotional commitment. Gain an Ally.

effect.description: Romantic relationship deepens - gain an Ally (romantic partner)

narrative.setup: Love blossomed into something deeper and more meaningful, creating a lasting bond.
narrative.consequence: This commitment would provide emotional support and partnership throughout their adventures.
narrative.worldBuilding: Deep emotional bonds transcend species and cultural boundaries, creating some of the strongest alliances in the galaxy.

events.title: New Relationship
events.description: You become involved in a romantic relationship. Gain an Ally.

effect.description: New romantic relationship begins - gain an Ally

narrative.setup: A chance encounter or growing friendship blossomed into romantic feelings.
narrative.consequence: This new relationship would add complexity and support to their life journey.
narrative.worldBuilding: Romance finds a way to flourish even in the harsh realities of interstellar life.

effect.description: Gain a new Contact (professional or social connection)

narrative.setup: A chance meeting or professional interaction created a valuable new connection.
narrative.consequence: This contact would prove useful in future endeavors, providing information or opportunities.
narrative.worldBuilding: In a galaxy of countless worlds and cultures, personal connections often prove more valuable than credits.

events.title: Betrayal
events.description: You are betrayed in some fashion by a friend. If you have any Contacts or Allies, convert one into a Rival and Enemy. Otherwise, gain a Rival or Enemy.

effect.description: Friend betrays you - convert existing Contact/Ally to Rival/Enemy, or gain new Rival/Enemy

narrative.setup: Trust was shattered when someone close revealed their true nature through betrayal.
narrative.consequence: This painful lesson in human nature would make them more cautious about whom to trust.
narrative.worldBuilding: Betrayal is a universal constant, cutting across all species and cultures with equal cruelty.

events.title: Travel
events.description: You move to another world. You gain DM+2 to your next qualification roll.

effect.description: Move to another world - gain DM+2 to next qualification roll

narrative.setup: Circumstances led them to pack their belongings and seek opportunities on a distant world.
narrative.consequence: This change of scenery would broaden their horizons and open new career possibilities.
narrative.worldBuilding: In an era of routine interstellar travel, changing worlds is often the key to changing one's fortune.

events.title: Good Fortune
events.description: Something good happens to you; you come into money unexpectedly, have a lifelong dream come true, get a book published or have some other stroke of good fortune. Gain DM+2 to any one Benefit roll.

effect.description: Stroke of good luck - gain DM+2 to any one Benefit roll

narrative.setup: Fortune smiled upon them as unexpected good luck transformed their circumstances.
narrative.consequence: This windfall would provide opportunities and resources for future endeavors.
narrative.worldBuilding: Even in the vast indifference of space, sometimes the universe grants unexpected gifts to the deserving.

events.title: Crime
events.description: You are the victim (or are accused) of a crime. Lose one Benefit roll or take the Prisoner career in your next term.

effect.description: Victim of crime or accused - lose Benefit roll or take Prisoner career

options.description: Lose one Benefit roll (legal fees, stolen property, etc.)
Take Prisoner career next term (wrongly accused or caught)

narrative.setup: The long arm of the law reached out to entangle them, whether as victim or accused.
narrative.consequence: This brush with the criminal justice system would leave lasting marks on their record and psyche.
narrative.worldBuilding: Crime and punishment follow familiar patterns across the galaxy, though methods and severity vary by world.

1.title: Psionics
1.description: You encounter a Psionic Institute. You may immediately test your Psionic Strength and, if you qualify, take the Psion career in your next term. See page 236 for more details.

2.title: Aliens
2.description: You spend time among an alien species. Gain a Science 1 and a Contact among an alien species.

3.title: Alien Artefact
3.description: You have a strange and unusual device from an alien culture that is not normally available to humans.

4.title: Amnesia
4.description: Something happened to you but you do not know what it was.

5.title: Contact with Government
5.description: You briefly came into contact with the highest echelons of the Imperium â€“ an Archduke or the Emperor, perhaps, or Imperial intelligence.

6.title: Ancient Technology
6.description: You have something older than the Imperium or even something older than humanity.

narrative.setup: Reality took a strange turn as they encountered something beyond normal experience.
narrative.consequence: This brush with the extraordinary would expand their understanding of the galaxy's hidden mysteries.
narrative.worldBuilding: The galaxy holds countless secrets and wonders that occasionally intrude upon ordinary lives in extraordinary ways.

metadata.title: Injury Table
metadata.description: Physical injuries and their consequences (referenced by Life Events roll 2)
metadata.usage: Roll 1D6 when Sickness or Injury life event occurs

injuries.title: Nearly killed
injuries.description: Reduce one physical characteristic (STR, DEX or END) by 1D6, reduce two other physical characteristics by 2 each.

injuries.title: Severely injured
injuries.description: Reduce one physical characteristic (STR, DEX or END) by 1D6.

injuries.title: Scarred
injuries.description: You are scarred and injured. No permanent effect.

effect.description: Permanent scarring but no mechanical effect

injuries.title: Injured
injuries.description: Reduce STR, DEX or END by 1.

narrative_themes.personal_growth: Life events that shape character development and emotional maturity
narrative_themes.relationships: The complex web of human connections that define our social existence
narrative_themes.fortune: The random nature of luck and misfortune that affects all lives
narrative_themes.mystery: Encounters with the strange and unexplained aspects of the galaxy

integration_notes.pre_career: Called by pre-career event roll 7 - 'Life Event'
integration_notes.career_events: Many career event tables reference life events
integration_notes.aging: Some aging effects may trigger life events
integration_notes.frequency: Can occur multiple times during character creation
